author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
Out of interest, how did you set the ball depth?
Am I right in thinking that it goes cab floor, spacer, gear shifter?
Did you have it in neutral whilst you fitted it and if not what gear were you in?

Cheers, Lee.

I set it in 2nd gear and removed the old shifter. Then got the ball and thread and popped it in the coupler. Wound the nut up until it was around level with the top of where the spacer plate would be then wound it in a couple of threads to allow for the angle and to ensure it didn't bottom out. Removed and fitted it to the shifter.
Spacer goes in the recess on the floor (early bay, cannot remember if my Split had the same recess, but I assume so), shifter on top of that. You can still see the ball in the coupler from above, so if the depths doesn't look quite right now is the time to adjust up or down. Easy peasy really, not like you have a slot to adjust on the shifter.
